parameters.visit:
Parental visits index
representing the number of visits to the school site
parameters.selfesteem: Coopersmith Self-Esteem Inventory, intended as a measure of self-esteem
parameters.mathematics: Mathematics score as measured by the Metropolitan Achievement Test
parameters.counseling:
Parent counseling index calculated from data on
time spent with child on school-related topics such as reading together, etc.
parameters.education:
Education level of mother as measured in
terms of percentage of high school graduates among female parents
parameters.reading: Reading score as measured by the Metropolitan Achievement Test
parameters.teacher: Number of teachers at a given site
parameters.occupation:
Highest occupation of a family member according
to a pre-arranged rating scale

title: School Data
description:
Description
School Data, from Charnes et al. (1981). The aim is to explain scores on 3
different tests, reading, mathematics and selfesteem
from 70 school sites by means of 5 explanatory variables related to parents
and teachers.
usage: A data frame with 70 observations on the following 8 variables.
reference: This dataset was shamelessly borrowed from the FRB package.
